metadata.name: Scythe #18
metadata.description: The title is chosen for the tool's purpose, to harvest. Remove what has already flourished and allow for new growth. This sets my intent to continue exploring my art through creative coding and generative art. The work uses the beauty of Bezier's curves alongside deep textures and rich colours. I wanted this work to stay grounded in my design background but as I wrote the code it allowed me to discover new ways of creating. I hope you the viewer, finds a connection with Scythe.

metadata.name: rflktr #185
metadata.description:
a generative artwork by Juhani Halkomäki

Celebrating my one year fxhash anniversary. The piece is based on my first project on fxhash, the Reflector. In this piece I continued the exploration on rays and reflection in 2D space. The end result is a colorful and fragile artwork with a hint of melancholy.

----

press 's' to save (only works after the piece has fully rendered)
press '1' to '9' to change the resolution

metadata.name: Mantle #145
metadata.description:
A colourful graphic exploration that I started in December 2021 and didn't finish until just now. 
Happy birthday FX! #fxhashturnsone

metadata.name: Digital Lava Lamp #60
metadata.description:
All primary sales are donated to @threejs
Best viewed on a decent GPU for 60FPS rendering

In celebration of the anniversary of fxhash, here is a playful interactive simulation, that attempts to replicate the feeling of an abstract lava lamp in a digital world.

[ Controls ]
Play with the physics by dragging your cursor/finger...
Or let the simulation do its thing by staying outside of the frame

[ f ] - fullscreen
[ s ] - save an image
[ r ] - restart the simulation

Created with Three.js + rapier.js
Copyright (c) November 2022 Shaderism

metadata.name: Punktwelt #231
metadata.description:
Continuing on the theme of color perception in Farbteiler, Punktwelt is an exploration of color interaction, projection and perceived depth, and the aesthetics of simple Boolean operations on form.

Each shape is the result of a single block, a rectangular cuboid, subjected to a series of Boolean subtractions with other blocks, and rendered in parallel projection, oblique or axonometric, in the abstract landscape of the Punktwelt.

Some have horizons, some have banded or striped backgrounds. The unnatural drawing order and chromatic differences of the individual faces sometimes yields illusory or paradoxical visual geometries.

Press ’s’ to save a png. Press ’4’ to export a high resolution png. Press ’8’ to export a very high resolution png. Press ’e’ to export an SVG file (may take some time and produce large files).

Aspect ratio variations are 4:5, 5:4, 2:3, 3:2 and 1:1.

Built in Javascript with p5.js, p5.svg and csg.js.

metadata.name: STRUCTURES #82
metadata.description:
STRUCTURES

What color do things look when you're happy?

First of all I want to dedicate this collection to all the people who paint their emotions with color, who through a chromatic range, are capable of feeling a universe of sensations most of the time inexplicable.....

 I am fascinated by how generative art creates a perfect symbiosis between art and technology, allowing through a set of algorithmic rules to give rise to compositions where shapes and colors coexist in balance, harmonized with each other that give rise to new creations.

This collection is designed to be self-contained and limited, recreating the view from different angles and phases of the day that can lead to disparate interpretations of a piece.

My work as a visual artist explores elements such as randomness and chance of linear formations and geometric gradients that broaden the spectrum to increasingly new concepts that I definitely want to explore.

I continually wonder what the geometric patterns that will emerge from my sensibility will be like and will give rise to new collections like this one, which is why I continue to investigate techniques and shapes while having fun.

"A painting is not the image of an experience, but it is the experience." Mark Rothk

metadata.name: HBDFXH01 #232
metadata.description:
Happy first birthday fxhash 🎂 🥳 😘

Press [s] in live view to save file as PNG.

This artwork was created using p5js and utilizes the p5.pattern library created by Taichi Sayama.

There are no rarity attributes assigned to this artwork, its value is intended to be determined by viewer aesthetic alone.

lisaorth.xyz
linktr.ee/lisaorthstudio
twitter: @lisaorthstudio

Splits:

25% of primary revenues go to KT1KYfj97fpdomqyKsZSBdSVvh9afh93b4Ge, the smart contract set up by Teia for donations for #Tezos4Iran, a charity fundraiser in solidarity with the protests and to raise awareness for women’s rights in Iran.

25% of primary revenues go to Women Who Code, an international nonprofit dedicated to empowering diverse women to excel in technology careers.

25% of primary revenues go to Savepakistan Flood Relief Fundraiser.

25% of primary revenues go to the Processing foundation.

metadata.name: Grande Dame #51
metadata.description:
Project inspired by the artworks of Vera Molnár ('Grande Dame' of digital art), one of the first women artists to use computers in her practice.

In January month of every year Π will party for Vera birth anniversary, artwork will come alive for the whole month.

Keys to interact:
[c] to change color mode (6 available)
[w] to raise wear level
[1] to [9] to change resolution
[s] to save as png (current settings)
[r] to reset all changes

Also in January:
[p] to pause/play animation
[r] to view standard artwork (paused)

Generative artwork by Gandhiavelli, @gandhiavelli. Made with p5js in 2022.

metadata.name: Tezumie 1-1 #633
metadata.description:
Tezumie have found themselves in Dimension 1-1, the perfect place for an adventure!

-WARNING-
They may seem to be a cute companion to hang out in your browser, but DO NOT leave them there for extended periods.  

Side effects may include: Missing items in your household, odd behavior in pets, a strange odor, prolonged nightmares, restless leg syndrome, hearing colors, missing teeth, uncontrollable urges, existential crisis, temporary blindness, and a strong appetite for non-edible objects.

Special Thanks to the following creators for permitting traits based on their art/style/projects;

AgataPoison, Craigers , griza, iRyanBell, Jim the Bim, KilledByAPixel, Liam Egan, Littlesilver, lucky26, MarkKnol, ozzie, PersonChen, punevyr, and the creators of MIME x MIME.

-CONTROLS-
(W)-Toggle weather
(F)-Toggle frame 
(C)-Toggle cursor
(P)–Pause
(A)-Shrink
(D)-Grow
(SHIFT + S)-Save image
(SHIFT + G)-Save 4 frames that you can use to make a GIF, see “sketch.js” for further instructions.

Made in p5js.
